TextView.android:text: In deletion clues, part(s) of a word are removed to get the solution. This type of clue ususally consists of four parts, which will be explained with an example

com.jamieholdstock.crossword.views.ClueV.app:clue: Plunderer loses head to go mad (5)

TextView.android:text: 1. Literal definition of the solution - 'mad' leads us to the solution 'irate'
2. Wordplay leading to the word which needs letters deleting - 'Plunderer' in the clue gives us 'pirate'
3. Deletion indicator - the indicator here is 'loses', as in 'loses some letters'
4. Letters to be deleted - 'head' tell us to remove the first letter of the word
Removing the head 'P' from 'PIRATE' gives us 'IRATE'
There are various types of deletion indicator:
- Remove letters from the beginning of a word. Indicators like: 'beheaded', 'start off', 'without introduction'.
- Remove letters from the end of a word. Indicators like: 'back off', 'mostly', 'without end'.
- Remove letters from both edges of a word. Indicators like: 'losing margins', 'trimmed', 'without limits'.
- Remove letters from the centre of a word. Indicators like: 'cored', 'disheartened', 'empty'
